intro: Zeuxine stammleri, commonly known as the Himalayan blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet petals, which are often speckled with contrasting colors. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs, helping to retain moisture. Zeuxine stammleri is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known flowering plants like poppies and罂粟.
